# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a simple implementation of the function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)

    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer id orci nec eros volutpat congue quis ut nunc. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; Nulla facilisi."
println(wrap_string(text))
```
This will output:
```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Integer id orci nec eros volutpat congue quis ut nunc.
Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; Nulla facilisi.
```
